p: A total of 75 (30.9%) patients required ICU admission and 31 (12.8%) died. In the multivariable analysis, age ≥75 years was associated with lower ICU admission (aOR 0.47, 95% CI: 0.23–0.94). The 65–74 years age group was not associated with ICU admission, but the statistical power was low (12%). COPD was also associated with ICU admission and chronic cardiovascular disease was associated with a lower ICU admission (aOR 0.42, 95% CI: 0.20–0.89) ( Fig 1 and S1 Table).
